layoutViewItemDTO Data Type

Represents an item inside a view.

Namespace
(Default)
Properties
name data type type namespace min/max occurs description
content string element 0/1 The content for the item. The value here depends on the element property (see the list of possible element property values).
element string element 0/1 Gets the element. This can be one of:
  • field - the item is a field reference. The field name is stored in the content property.
  • html - the item is an HTML block. The HTML content is stored in the content property.
  • header - the item is a header. The header text is stored in the content property.
  • section - the item is a section. The content property is ignored. The list of sub-items is stored in the "fields" property.
  • tab - the item is a tab. The content property is ignored. The list of sub-items (sections, fields, etc.) is stored in the "fields" property.
field_type string element 0/1 The type of object to which this view item applies. Currently, the following values are supported:
  • incident
  • actioninvocation
fields layoutViewItemDTO element 0/unbounded The list of fields in the view.
predefined_uuid string element 0/1 Some of the items are "predefined" by the server. We give them a well-known UUID so users can reset back to the known state.
show_if layoutViewConditionDTO element 0/unbounded List of conditions that must be true in order to show the view (applicable only for items with an "element" property value of "section").
show_link_header boolean element 1/1 Link header should be displayed or not. This property is for UI side use only
step_label string element 0/1 The step label (if applicable).

Example

<l----->
  <step_label>...</step_label>
  <fields/>
  <show_if>
    <condition>...</condition>
    <field>...</field>
    <value>...</value>
  </show_if>
  <element>...</element>
  <field_type>...</field_type>
  <content>...</content>
  <predefined_uuid>...</predefined_uuid>
  <show_link_header>...</show_link_header>
</l----->
